result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles A. Mitchell

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 10:45 am.

2:59 PM Cases 22CF20, 22CF43, 22CF147, and 22CM36 called together.  Defendant Charles A. Mitchell in court, in custody.  Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton in court for Charles A. Mitchell.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Case 22CF147 is on for preliminary hearing.  Atty Lawton updates- defendant wants to waive the preliminary hearing.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information mirroring complaint.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:20 AM Cases 22CF20, 22CF43, 2022CF000147, and 2022CM000036 called together. Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles A. Mitchell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton appeared in person for Charles A. Mitchell.  Def appears by video from Bayfield County jail.  Case 22CF147 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. WTLPH.  Court addresses a bond motion, will hear argument.  Atty Lawton argues in support of his bond motion to allow def to attend programming.  ADA Schmidt responds, opposed to bond modification.  Court denies bond motion at this time.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.

11:35 AM Cases 22CF20, 2022CF000043, 2022CF000147, and 2022CM000036 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles A. Mitchell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton in court for Charles A. Mitchell.  Atty Lawton updates- not appointed in the new file (on for initial appearance).  Court appoints Atty Lawton in 21CF147.  Adjourned initial appearance to be set in that matter.
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant must post $50,000 additional cash bond to be released from custody (for a total of $55,250 to cover Burnett County cases 22GF160, 22CM36, 22CF43, and 22CF20).  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.
Status conference on June 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:00 AM Cases 22CF43, 22CF20, 22CM36 called together.  Defendant, Charles A. Mitchell, appeared with Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State. Cases 22CF20 and 22CF43 on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Atty Lawton updates- likely ready to set a plea/sentencing, believes agreement is for plea to 1 count possession of narcotics with a joint recommendation of probation.  Discussion of the offer/agreement.  Discussion of the charges- Count 1 of the information in 22CF43 not correctly displayed in CCAP- clerk to resolve.  Discussion of basis for the amendment.  Parties request status conference.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on May 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:02 AM Cases 22CF20, 22CF43, and 22CM36 called together.  Defendant, Charles A. Mitchell, appeared with Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Felony files were set for preliminary hearing, but defense indicates these will be waivers.  Cases 22CF20 and 22CF43 proceed to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waivers of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State will file information for 22CF20 mirroring complaint; requests separate arraignment for 22CF43 to file an information that differs from complaint- will be a simple possession, basis provided.  Status Conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

02:51 PM Called 21FO398 and 22CM36 for STC, and 22CF20 and 22CF43 for PHs. Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton in court.  ADA Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No appearance by the def.  State notes that def is listed on MN VINE, and he just looked up Scott County, MN jail roster which lists the def, arrested yesterday on new charges.  State requests WA, default on FO.  Court finds def in default on 21FO398.  Attny Lawton would object, but court finds he is not the Attny for that case.  Court orders on 21FO398 a NC plea will be entered, findings of Guilty made, def has 60 days to pay.  Court orders a WA in WI body only in 21CM36, and for 22CF20 and 22CF43 WA in WI and MN body only.  Nothing else from either party.
Status conference on April 28, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

09:13 AM Cases 22CF20, 22CF43, 22CM36, and 21FO398 called together.  Defendant, Charles A. Mitchell, appeared with Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Case 22CF20 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def's address is current, but def needs to contact the post office.  NG pleas to misdemeanors.  WTLPH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's second pro se bond motion
Status conference on March 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's pro-se bond motion

01:05 PM Cases 21FO398, 22CF20, 22CF43, and 22CM36 called together.  Defendant Charles A. Mitchell in court, in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles A. Mitchell appeared by video means.  Def has applied for PD, one not yet appointed.  Def enters NG in FO and CM cases.  Cases 22CF20, 22CF43, and 22CM36 on for Initial Appearances.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaints, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def has not received the criminal complaint.  Initial appearance will be adjourned in 22CF20.  Cases proceed to a bond motion hearing.  Def argues for signature bond.  DA argues against bond modification.  Court denies bond modification.  Bond continues.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
